subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Mission Drift: When Purpose Gets Lost
description: A 60-second lesson on Mission Drift: When Purpose Gets Lost.

hook.text: A social enterprise starts with a bold mission. Then investors arrive. Then the mission starts to bend.

buildup.text: Mission drift happens when financial pressure slowly pulls a social enterprise from its original purpose.

discovery.text: SKS Microfinance in India began by lending to poor women. After its IPO, it chased growth relentlessly.

twist.text: Loan officers pressured borrowers so hard that a wave of suicides swept rural India. Purpose had vanished.

climax.text: SKS became a warning: when growth targets replace mission targets, a social enterprise loses its soul.

punchline.text: Profit can fund the mission or quietly bury it.

quiz.question: What is mission drift in the context of social enterprises?
options: When a company expands into new geographic markets too quickly
When financial pressures gradually pull an organization away from its social mission
When employees lose motivation due to low salaries
